article_title: How much federal funding does Idaho get? More than most states
article_text:
Idaho gets proportionally more than 35 other states

$2.6 billion from federal government for coming year

State’s low income means higher federal reimbursement rate

article_metadata.news-keywords: Medicaid, Medicare, ID, Iowa, largesse, feds, U.S., government, Health and Welfare, H&W
article_metadata.description: Idaho receives more federal funding relative to its total spending than two-thirds of all states. And because of its near-bottom average wages, it is reimbursed for social programs at a higher rate than all but two. The state’s proposed budget for next year is one-third funded by federal dollars—a rate more or less consistent over the last several years.
article_metadata.title: How much federal funding does Idaho get? More than most states | Idaho Statesman
